Sentence.sentence: The retail giant said the poor financial performance this year has pushed it to begin implementing $400 million in cost-cutting measures.

They include such measures as accountable care organizations to take charge of a patient's needs with an eye on both cost and quality, and chronic disease management to make sure the seriously ill, who are responsible for the bulk of all health care costs, are treated properly.

Measuring emissions is not a precise science, particularly when it comes to issues surrounding land use; not all nations have released up-to-date data, and in any case, emissions from some sectors such as aviation are not included in national statistics.
It helps advertisers to measure the click-through rates.
But researchers are improving systems to measure a teacher's performance throughout the year, and, with three years of data, it's usually possible to tell which teachers are failing.
As a report in The New England Journal of Medicine concluded, Pretty much every proposed innovation found in the health policy literature these days is contained in these measures.
Parents, teachers, even the kids themselves, scored the youngsters on measures like acting before thinking and persistence in reaching goals.
Since tobacco is one of the biggest causes of premature death in the UK, a measure that tames the habit even by a fraction is worth trying.
The passive attitude we have to climate change as individuals can be altered by counting us in — and measuring us against - our peer group.
"Nearly everyone I know is addicted in some measure to the Internet," wrote Tony Schwartz in New York times.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Researchers used ACT scores as a measure of intellectual aptitude.
She's using CT scans to measure muscle size and fat, and comparing seniors on a high-protein diet with those on regular diets.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The Jones-Klenow measure can also assess an economy's performance over time.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The results of a recent experiment showed that professors can use standardized metrics to measure how well students do in three key areas: critical thinking, written communication, and quantitative literacy.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: To measure the effects of Internet-based distractions during class, researchers,  evaluated 500 students taking an introductory psychology class at michigan State University.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"标准"之意。
means: standard ： 指公认为决定事物质量或人的品质的准则或原则。
criterion ： 较正式用词，指判断、批评事物的标准，但不一定制成了规章。
measure与standard基本同义，但多用于比喻，指衡量某事物的质量准则。
gauge ： 专指测量物体大小、厚度、直径等的标准规格。

stems_affixes.word_buile: im不+measurable[adj.可测量的]→adj.不可计量的,无限的
measure[v.测量,分派,权衡 n.尺寸,量度器,措施,办法]+able可以……的→adj.可测量的
meas计量,测量+ure→v.测量,分派,权衡 n.尺寸,量度器,措施,办法
com共同+measure测量→测量尺寸相同,相等
meas计量,测量+ure→v.测量,分派,权衡 n.尺寸,量度器,措施,办法

word_mean: 量，计：确定某物质的范围或量
测定一物质的大小或质量的度量器：见weight

Sentence.sentence: In a society that tends to measure everything in terms of dollars and cents, we learn form a young age to consider the costs of our decisions in financial terms.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, they made only half as many errors as those wearing their own clothes on the stroop test one way of measuring attention.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: It found many youngsters now measure their status by how much public approval they get online, often through "likes".
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Some immigrant advocates worry that as hard financial times make it more difficult for natives to keep jobs, such measures will become more a vehicle for intolerance than integration.

Sentence.sentence: They have reduced pollution through effective measures.

Sentence.sentence: This nature of data makes the antitrust measures of the past less useful.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: This smart keyboard precisely measures the cadence with which one types and the pressure fingers apply to each key.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: It may be said that the measure of the worth of any social institution is its effect in enlarging and improving experience; but this effect is not a part of its original motive.

Rather than concluding that children make parents either happy or miserable, Senior suggests we need to redefine happiness: instead of thinking of it as something that can be measured by moment-to-moment joy, we should consider being happy as a past-tense condition.

Such measures have a couple of uplifting motives.
This is a lesson that rich countries can learn : When GDP is no longer regarded as the sole measure of a country’s success, the world looks very different.
Some relatively poor European countries have seen huge improvements across measures including civil society , income equality and the environment.
So, what Kennedy was referring to was that while GDP has been the most common method for measuring the economic activity of nations , as a measure , it is no longer enough.

Rather than just focusing on GDP, over 40 different sets of criteria from health, education and civil society engagement have been measured to get a more rounded assessment of how countries are performing.
Kennedy once said that a country’s GDP measures “everything except that which makes life worthwhile.”
It measures things that do not matter and misses things that do.
Enhanced security measures since then, combined with a rise in airline travel due to the improving Chicago’s O’Hare International.
By most recent measures, the UK’s GDP has been the envy of the Western world, with record low unemployment and high growth figures.
Across the 163 countries measured, the UK is one of the poorest performers in ensuring that economic growth is translated into meaningful improvements for its citizens.

Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: You must measure accurately.
sentences.cn: 你一定要量准。

sentences.en: They measured the strength of an electric current.
sentences.cn: 他们测量了电流的强度。

sentences.en: He measured the rope to see if it was long enough.
sentences.cn: 他量了那根绳子看是否够长。

sentences.en: This is a yardstick for measuring whether a person is really progressive.
sentences.cn: 这是衡量一个人是否真正进步的标准。

sentences.en: It's hard to measure his ability when we haven't seen his work.
sentences.cn: 没有见过他的作品, 很难估计他的能力。

sentences.en: He's a man who measures his words.
sentences.cn: 他是个用词很讲究的人。

means.word_mean: (通过竞争, 冲突等)考验某事物, 较量

sentences.en: You have to measure your determination with that of other people.
sentences.cn: 你得与其他人较量一下决心了。

sentences.en: That old tree must measure at least 30 metres from top to bottom.
sentences.cn: 那棵老树从地面到树梢至少有30米。

sentences.en: The tailor took my measure for a new suit.
sentences.cn: 裁缝量了我的尺寸准备为我做套新衣服。

sentences.en: He took the measure of the cliff before he climbed it.
sentences.cn: 他把悬崖的高度估量一下后再攀登。

sentences.en: The measure is given in centimetres.
sentences.cn: 按厘米进行测量。

sentences.en: The barman uses a small silver measure for brandy.
sentences.cn: 酒吧招待员用一个小银制量器量白兰地。

sentences.en: We did reach a considerable measure of agreement.
sentences.cn: 我们确实取得了很大程度的一致。

sentences.en: The measures had a detrimental effect.
sentences.cn: 这些措施已产生不良影响。

sentences.en: We should take appropriate measures to improve our teaching.
sentences.cn: 我们应当采取适当的措施提高教学质量。

means.word_mean: (用一种标准测量的)尺寸；大小；分量；重量

data.mean: 估量，判定（重要性、价值或影响等）

sentence.cn: Tononi的团队测量了12只小鼠大脑中这些连接或突触的大小。
sentence.en: Tononi’s team measured the size of these connections,  or synapses,  in the brains of 12 mice.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解  七选五 原文

sentence.cn: 它发现许多年轻人（少年）现在通过他们获得的公众认可程度（通常是通过“点赞”数）来衡量他们的身份。
sentence.en: It found many youngsters now measure their status by how much public approval they get online,  often through  " likes ".
sentence.from: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

mean.mean: 估量，判定（重要性、价值或影响等）

lj.lj_ly: a candidate who just didn't measure up.

jx.jx_en_mean: assess or have assessed the character, nature, or abilities of (someone or something)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 评估…的特性（或本质、能力）

lj.lj_ly: he's got her measure—she won't fool him.
lj.lj_ls: 他已经摸到了她的个性——她不会欺骗他。

lj.lj_ly: his rapid promotion was due in some measure to his friendship with the king.
lj.lj_ls: 他的快速提升一定程度上同他与国王的友情有关。

jx.jx_en_mean: (dated)(of a person) fall flat on the ground
a standard unit of volume used for containers, liquids, and substances such as grain
In addition to the required amount.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 另外：附加于要求的数量

phrase.cizu_name: in a measure 或 in some measure

lj.lj_ly: The new law was in a measure harmful.
lj.lj_ls: 新的法律在某种程度上说是有害的

entry.def: If you measure the quality, value, or effect of something, you discover or judge how great it is.

example.ex: I continued to measure his progress against the charts in the doctor's office...
example.tran: 我继续比照医生办公室里的图表来判断他病情的发展。

example.ex: A grammar school's success was measured in terms of the number of pupils who got into university...
example.tran: 一所文法学校成功与否是以考上大学的学生人数为衡量依据的。

entry.def: If you measure a quantity that can be expressed in numbers, such as the length of something, you discover it using a particular instrument or device, for example a ruler.

example.ex: Measure the length and width of the gap...
example.tran: 测量一下这条缝隙的长与宽。

example.ex: He measured the speed at which ultrasonic waves travel along the bone.
example.tran: 他测出了超声波穿过骨头的速度。

entry.def: If something measures a particular length, width, or amount, that is its size or intensity, expressed in numbers.
entry.tran: 距离(或长度、宽度、数量等)为…

example.ex: The house is more than twenty metres long and measures six metres in width...
example.tran: 这座房子长20多米，宽6米。

example.ex: This hand-decorated plate measures 30cm across...
example.tran: 这只手工绘制的盘子直径为30厘米。

entry.def: A measure of a particular quality, feeling, or activity is a fairly large amount of it.

example.ex: With the exception of Juan, each attained a measure of success...
example.tran: 除了胡安之外，每个人都获得了相当大的成功。

example.ex: The colonies were claiming a larger measure of self-government.
example.tran: 殖民地正要求获得更大程度上的自治。

entry.def: If you say that one aspect of a situation is a measure of that situation, you mean that it shows that the situation is very serious or has developed to a very great extent.
entry.tran: （情形严重或发展到了一定程度的）体现，表现，标志

example.ex: It is a measure of their plight that few of them have anywhere to go to...
example.tran: 他们几乎全都无处可归，看得出他们是陷入了困境。

example.ex: That is a measure of how bad things have become at the bank.
example.tran: 那简直就是银行里糟糕局面的写照。

entry.def: When someone, usually a government or other authority, takes measures to do something, they carry out particular actions in order to achieve a particular result.

example.ex: The government warned that police would take tougher measures to contain the trouble...
example.tran: 政府警告说，警方将采取更为强硬的措施来遏制动乱。

example.ex: He said stern measures would be taken against the killers...
example.tran: 他说将会采取严厉措施惩罚凶手。

entry.def: A measure of a strong alcoholic drink such as brandy or whisky is an amount of it in a glass. In pubs and bars, a measure is an official standard amount.

example.ex: He poured himself another generous measure of malt.
example.tran: 他又为自己倒了满满一大杯麦芽威士忌。

example.ex: ...a pub measure of spirits.
example.tran: 一杯烈酒

entry.def: In music, a measure is one of the several short parts of the same length into which a piece of music is divided.
If you say that something has changed or that it has affected you beyond measure, you are emphasizing that it has done this to a great extent.

example.ex: Mankind's knowledge of the universe has increased beyond measure...
example.tran: 人类对于宇宙的了解已经大为增加。

example.ex: She irritated him beyond measure.
example.tran: 她让他大为光火。

entry.def: If you say that something is done for good measure, you mean that it is done in addition to a number of other things.

example.ex: I repeated my question for good measure...
example.tran: 另外，我重复了我的问题。

example.ex: For good measure, a few details of hotels were included.
example.tran: 除此之外还包括对宾馆的一些详细介绍。

entry.def: If you get or take the measure of someone or something, you discover what they are like, so that you are able to control them or deal with them. If you have the measure of someone or something, you have succeeded in doing this.
entry.tran: 了解;熟悉;估量…的能力/掂量出…的分量;摸清…的底细

example.ex: The governments of the industrialized world had failed to get the measure of the crisis...
example.tran: 工业化国家的政府没能意识到这次危机的严重程度。

example.ex: Has he taken the measure of us and concluded that we're not willing to risk a life?...
example.tran: 他有没有掂掂我们的分量，知道我们并不愿冒生命危险？

entry.def: If something is true in some measure or in large measure, it is partly or mostly true.
entry.tran: 在某种程度上/在很大程度上

example.ex: Power is in some measure an act of will...
example.tran: 权力在某种程度上是意志的表现。

example.ex: In Britain, we have so far escaped, in large measure, either of these afflictions.
example.tran: 在英国，我们迄今为止已经远远地避开了这两类麻烦。

means.word_mean: 1. the act or process of measuring;
2. a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated;

sentences.sentence: "they set the measure for all subsequent work"

means.word_mean: 3. how much there is of something that you can quantify
4. any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal;

sentences.sentence: "the police took steps to reduce crime"

means.word_mean: 5. a statute in draft before it becomes law;

sentences.sentence: "they held a public hearing on the bill"

means.word_mean: 6. (prosody) the accent in a metrical foot of verse
7. musical notation for a repeating pattern of musical beats;

sentences.sentence: "the orchestra omitted the last twelve bars of the song"

means.word_mean: 8. measuring instrument having a sequence of marks at regular intervals; used as a reference in making measurements
1. determine the measurements of something or somebody, take measurements of;
2. express as a number or measure or quantity;
4. place a value on; judge the worth of something;

sentences.sentence: "I will have the family jewels appraised by a professional"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a noun in the senses 'moderation', 'instrument for measuring', 'unit of capacity'): from Old French mesure, from Latin mensura, from mens- 'measured', from the verb metiri
